div.l: Say forth thy tale and tary not the tyme
Lo depford ⁊ it is halfwey to pryme
Lo grenewich that many a sherwe is ynne
It were al tyme thy tale to begynne
Now sires quod thys oswold the reue
I pray you al that ye you not greue
Though þt I answere ⁊ somdel sette his houue
For leful is wyth force / force of shouue
Thys dronkyn myllere hath told vs here
How that begylyd was a carpentere
Parauenture in scorn for that I am one
And by your leue I shal hym quyte anon
Ryght in hys chorlis termys wol I speke
I pray to god hys necke mowe to breke
He can wel in myn eye se a stalk
But in hys owen he can not se a balk
